title: A suggested nerf for Veigar, because obviously Riot and the community want it
body:
Make his Q have 100 range and take 5 seconds to reach that range, make his W do 10/20/30/40/50 (.1 AP) magic damage and increase the time it takes to come down to a flat 5 seconds AT CAST (because we want that AMAZING BUFF you did to stick around), make his E not stun the enemy but just tickle them uncomfortably when they pass through it, and remove his ultimate and replace it with an ability that damages himself based on how much AP he's bought.

If you're gonna cripple the little guy, do it all at once. We Veigar mains have seen him suffer enough throughout the seasons, we don't want to watch him have to go through the "balance changes" you tend to do to all FOTM champs that the Bronzies start crying "OP!" to; it'd be like watching a little black kitten being given something it loves (and a bit of kindness) after being abused for so long only to then take that thing away, destroy it in front of it, then beat it with a bat (a NERF bat). Please just end his suffering all at once, we can't stand to watch the cruelty, brought about by low ELO retards, that will obviously unfold.

In essence, don't Kha'Zix/Cassiopeia the little fucker. Just pull the plug immediately so we Veigar mains don't have to watch our favorite champion suffer again.

Good God.

Well I don't know about you, but generally I get about 30 kill participation on Veigar in an average game where I do well. Generally that's like, 12 kills and 18 assists lets say (and you get assists just by trapping someone INSIDE your cage, you don't even need to stun them or do damage to get an assist!)

So, originally you'd get AP from those 12 kills, which is 60 additional AP.
If you include assists, that's a total of 150 additional AP, just from killing champions, which is 110 AP more than before.

That's more than any item in the game can give you, unless you get Seraph's Embrace and then get a ton of mana.

If you include that fact that his W and his Ult have 100% AP scaling ratios, and his Q has a 60% AP scaling ratio, then that extra 110 AP that you didn't have before converts to 286 extra damage in your full burst combo.
The ratio nerf that was on the PBE was way over the top and a hit to what Veigar is supposed to be, the new nerfs on the pbe are "better" as it hits his base dmg only on W and Q.
Yeah, I just saw that. I think I'm happy with just base damage changes. Veigar's W is hard enough to hit as it is, so it should give a significant reward.

Like you hit 2 champions in a row ever time you throw a Q....

Another exmaple, season 4 with {{champion:115}} . I am personnaly a big Ziggs player since season 3, and I got trashtalked alot for picking Ziggs. He got some little buffs, mostly CD reductions on his W in season 4, some pro player picked him "OMG Ziggs lane bully cant do anything qq". Well, dodge the Q's would've been a great option. Then they nerfed his ult cooldown by alot in later ranks, and completly broke his Q's hitbox. I dont play him anymore cause I often miss Q's that would've hitted before, and I cant stand that bs hitbox, when the bomb sometimes jump over something instead of hitting something, cause its hitbox is so small. And ofc, Ziggs was never seen again till this day, even after fairly strong Q mana cost reduction buffs.

And now Veigar, considered prue trash after his rework. As a skillshot mages mid main, I tried him, cause he more skillshots then before. I quite played him a bit befor, but I found him fairly boring to play. After the rework, he was alot more amusing, fairly underpowered but truly viable. I wrote a topic directly after the rework claming Veigar still is good champ, and you can hit E if you play correctly, but no, the community decided to whine instead of actually trying the champ.

Some buffs later, Veigar still not played at all, one small buff afterwards, still no one playing him. Some days after the patch, some pro played him, carried with him, and suddenly he becomes broken and blame the latest patch. 

I mean, if Veigar had no counterplay, I could understand, like LB was forgotten for long but became popular after pros playing her, she was still broken cause of her kit that clearly lacked (and still lacks) couterplay. Sometimes, some broken champs arent just meta but if those were to rise, they would get alot of (this time right) QQ. Swain comes in mind.

But Veigar, come on, not only you can counter him by dodging his skillshots, you can punish him extremly hard by buying QSS. You can buy it fairly easy without risks, since Veigars early isnt good, so you have plenty of time getting gold to counteritemize against him.

If that's not enough, you can counter him by buying tenactiy, MR, or going for utility mage items with low AP (Going for exmaple for haunting guise instead of needlessly large rod).

"Its same with Zed, just get Zhonya and he's done". How many times people just said that to people that were complaining about Zed when they clamed he was an unfair oppenent (which he is) ? "But omg, you said I need to get an item to counter Veigar and that hes not broken because of that, but Zed is broken when you get Zhonya QQ ?"

Yes, because first, Zhonya cost about 2.5 times the cost of QSS, secondly, Zed is strong in early, he can tear you apart beore you get your Zhonya, and while you get it, too late, he be feasting on bot lane.

Veigar isnt much of a thread before 6, because his poke is meh before that, and he'll probably farm with his Q instead of poking with it (By a side note, a poke that can be easily dodged)

Phew long post here, hope people finally realise what really a broken champ is and what not.

Yes, wood division's most perceptive minds saw that the Veigar that had been forsaken by the LCS gods after his fall from grace had suddenly clawed his way out of the hell that their incredible ineptitude put him in and thought they'd lose the ability to stargaze mid match without punishment. His numbers were increased and a bit of reliability was added but that's not what they bitch about, its his "god mode" E that takes a half second to form and a hundredth of that time to sidestep which wasn't even touched. You know how before he was gutted in 5.4 his E was lackluster in terms of zone control since every one and their crippled grandmother could dash through it? They called for the utility shift and now they're bitching about it once again.

What the hell was the point of this thread?
So far the only Veigar nerfs I can find are:
1. Dark Matter (W) damage reduced to 100/150/200/250/300 from 120/170/220/270/320
2. Dark Matter (W) AP Ratio  reduced to 0.8 from 1
Which is notable, sure, but it doesn't change that Veigar has immense burst and his great zoning from Event Horizon. Besides, plenty of high level players have voiced their concerns about Veigar being too strong right now and leaving a champion in that state (ignoring the fact that Riot has definitely gone too far with nerfs before) is silly.
Let's wait and see what happens next before jumping to conclusions.

Face it, they're gonna nerf him into the ground. They're going to Akali/Kha'Zix/Cassiopeia/Kassadin (with his Riftlimp) him. History has shown that if a champion is strong and the community complains about it then Riot overnerfs them to compensate. The problem is that Veigar is not overpowered; there are many ways to counter him. He is flavor of the month. There's no arguing that he is powerful at the moment, but not so powerful that he needs lots of nerfs. They are going to overnerf him, which will send him back to a state of utter mediocrity. They will either do it at a medium pace or they will do it very slowly. Either way, history has shown that the most likely course of "balance" Riot will take is over nerfing Veigar, sending him back into the "never picked for a good reason" zone.

This may seem like a little nerf, but it really isn't. It's about a 220 dmg nerf for Veigar's late game considering he will likely have around 1k AP; which is an AOE nerf, meaning it can potentially be a bigger damage nerf if his W would hit more than 1 person. The worst part is, this is not even going to stop him from being a popular pick, meaning that people will keep complaining about him until he is completely killed (or another "OMG SO OP" pick takes his place on the "RIOT NERF OMG SO STUPID! THIS CHAMP IS THE REASON I AM STUCK IN MY DIVISION!!!!!"), meaning that Riot will keep nerfing him until that happens. He's gonna go through some tough times, eventually becoming around the low 40's winrate again (if not worse than that). Yet again, history has shown this to be true and this will not change for Veigar.

In essence, Veigar is gonna get killed by Riot and the bitchy community. When it happens, I am going to start another thread and quote this exact post of mine to tell you all that I was correct.. that I am ALWAYS CORRECT (seriously, look at my posts. I have predicted throughout the seasons so many things, such as Support Fiddle being OP, Tanky jungle Yi with Titanic Hydra becoming a thing, I predicted Veigar's E would be able to stop dashes the day before it was announced, that Teemo would be able to throw his shrooms in a future update, and so many more things; I EVEN PREDICTED THAT A BUFF TO VEIGAR WOULD MAKE HIM PICK/BAN JUST A FEW MONTHS BACK). This is happening. Veigar's time to die is upon us soon enough.

Veigar was NEVER overpowered. He has always thrived on noobish mistakes and always maintained a balanced play and win rate, but every goddamn time he got featured in LCS, a giant bronze monolith amasses to feed tears into riot's ears in appeal of him being dumpstered.

Honestly the W nerf is better than an R nerf, though. his W at rank 5 is basically another rank 2 ultimate, so tuning the damage a bit is really not the end of the world - it's still gonna chunk, just not as hard as early, which is fine. This nerf is better than removing stuff on his ult, because I think his ultimate is fine where it is (though people wanna complain) - this is something that doesn't REALLY hurt Veigar's seige/push/waveclear/etc but does reduce his ability to burst tanky targets as easily (since a squishy target is still gonna die to Q>R or Q>W>R, even with the damage changes).

No veigar main is worried that the W nerf will break him, they're worried that Riot will take the shit too far like they did in 5.4 and completely ruin him again. Since he's designed to stomp noobs, noobs will always have a problem with him.

It seems like it's the "low elo retards" who are defending him.

Every high elo player I've talked to who doesn't main him understands the fact that he's way too strong right now.

- Build Magic Resist to counter burst (abyssal, merc, banshees, hex)
- Freeze wave at Turret so he can't farm well
- Have a Jungler like Elise to camp a bit (it works so well)
- Deny him farm (poke or trade)
- Bait his stun
- Good Veigars know to just farm at turret. New or Bad ones will try to kill you, but its so obvious when they do (try to stun you) like an Annie with no flash
- Zhonyas to counter ult (if stunned then ;-;)
- Don't be close too much in fights, stay in back line if Carry
- Profit
